title: Coesia Group to Showcase Sustainable Packaging, Automation Solutions at PACK EXPO - Packaging Strategies
summary: Coesia showcases its innovative packaging solutions at PACK EXPO in Las Vegas, emphasizing sustainability and automation. The group presents GREENMATION, aimed at meeting consumer demands for reusable packaging amid labor shortages. Attendees will see first-time launches of automation solutions like FlexLink's BRIXX and R.A Jones' Intelligent Flexible Transfer System. Coesia supports manufacturers in their automation journey to enhance production reliability.

business_innovation: TRUE: The introduction of new products and processes at the expo, like BRIXX and iFTS, qualifies as business innovation as they differ significantly from previous offerings.

title: Ball Aerosol Packaging releases new report on innovative Eyeris® printing technology for sustainable aluminum ... - Ball
summary: Ball Corporation has introduced Eyeris®, a proprietary enhanced printing technology for aluminum cans and bottles, which aims to meet the rising consumer demand for sustainable packaging. Eyeris® delivers high-resolution imagery, allowing brands to visually communicate their products while maintaining the sustainable qualities of aluminum packaging, which is lightweight and infinitely recyclable. The new technology not only enhances brand visibility but also reduces waste by eliminating the need for additional labels, further supporting environmental sustainability. This innovation reflects Ball's commitment to sustainable practices in packaging design.
green_innovation: TRUE - Eyeris® technology contributes to environmental sustainability by minimizing waste through the elimination of additional labels and promoting the use of recyclable aluminum packaging.
business_innovation: TRUE - The introduction of Eyeris® represents a significant improvement in packaging technology, addressing market demands for visually appealing and sustainable packaging solutions.
green_product: TRUE - Eyeris® enhances the environmental profile of aluminum cans by providing a sustainable packaging solution that reduces waste and enhances recyclability.
green_process: TRUE - The printing process utilized by Eyeris® reduces environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by minimizing additional materials used in packaging design.

title: Private label products growing in popularity due to price, quality and sustainability, research shows - FoodNavigator.com
summary: A recent report indicates that 70% of consumers in Europe regularly purchase private label products, with a significant portion citing price and quality as major factors. Many consumers also appreciate private labels for their local production and perceived sustainability efforts, with 34% noting improvements in food waste reduction and sustainable packaging. The article highlights a shift towards eco-conscious shopping and emphasizes the role of sustainable packaging in consumer choices. However, a notable percentage of consumers feel that manufacturers need to do more to reduce excessive packaging.

title: European Commission Adopts Measures Restricting Intentional Microplastics - Cosmetics & Toiletries
summary: The European Commission (EC) has adopted measures to restrict microplastics intentionally added to various products to protect the environment, preventing the release of approximately half a million tonnes of microplastics. The measures target a broad range of products, including cosmetics, detergents, and fertilizers, while allowing exceptions and transition periods for manufacturers. Specific bans include the prohibition of microbeads in rinse-off cosmetics, with a focus on ensuring appropriate disposal methods to minimize microplastic emissions. The EC emphasizes the need for stakeholder adaptation before the rules are fully enforced.
green_innovation: TRUE: This is a green innovation as it seeks to reduce environmental harm by restricting microplastics, which are a significant source of pollution.
business_innovation: FALSE: The article focuses on regulatory measures rather than detailing a specific new or improved product or process from a company.
green_product: FALSE: The article discusses regulatory actions rather than a specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product.
green_process: TRUE: The article describes a process (the regulation and restriction of microplastics) aimed at minimizing environmental impact, which fits the definition of a green process.

title: Sustainable strides: Mengniu overcomes recyclability challenges of dairy packaging - FoodNavigator-Asia.com
summary: Mengniu is working to improve the recyclability of its dairy packaging by using Dow's INNATE TF-BOPE resins to create mono-material packaging, which can enhance recycling processes. The company aims for 100% technically recyclable packaging by 2025, reflecting a commitment to sustainability amid rising eco-consciousness among Chinese consumers. Mengniu's sustainable development strategy, called GREEN, supports environmentally friendly production and sustainable practices. The collaboration with Dow aims to advance the development of sustainable packaging and promote consumer education on responsible consumption.

green_product: TRUE: The new yoghurt pouch exemplifies a green product as it is designed to minimize environmental impact through its recyclable and sustainable materials.

title: Amcor research shows strong demand for own brand food - FoodManufacture.co.uk
summary: A survey of over 3,000 shoppers across several European countries revealed that 85% prioritize price when choosing private label products, with 51% attributing their continued purchases to perceived quality. Sustainability and packaging also play a growing role in consumer behavior, with over 40% believing improvements in sustainability have been made for own brand products. Despite concerns about sustainability and price, quality remains a crucial factor in consumer decisions, with many consumers perceiving no difference in quality between private-label and branded items.

summary: Omnia Packaging, a Canadian subsidiary of Gruppo Sunino, has established operations in Guelph, Ontario, bringing sustainable solutions in packaging, including a glue-free paper-based solution to replace PET trays. title: CEFLEX Teams up with Recyda to Facilitate Sustainable Design Check Tool - Packaging Strategies
summary: Since their launch in 2020, the CEFLEX ‘Designing for a Circular Economy’ (D4ACE) guidelines have been adopted by thousands of organizations to optimize flexible packaging for recycling and to produce higher quality recycled materials. CEFLEX has introduced the ‘Design Check’ tool, developed in collaboration with Recyda, to help users assess whether their packaging designs adhere to the D4ACE guidelines. This tool allows assessment of existing and new packaging designs based on various compatibility factors related to sorting and recycling principles. It aims to streamline the design process and facilitate ongoing progress toward circular design in the flexible packaging market.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it directly contributes to reducing environmental impacts by enhancing the recyclability of flexible packaging and promoting circular economy principles.

green_product: FALSE. The article does not describe a specific good or service that meets the definition of a green product; rather, it discusses guidelines and tools for assessing packaging designs.
green_process: TRUE. The 'Design Check' tool is a green process as it provides a method to assess and improve the environmental sustainability of packaging designs, aiding in waste reduction and resource conservation.

title: Molpack, HP Team Up to Revolutionize Molded Fiber Production in Latin America - Packaging Strategies
summary: Guamolsa, part of Molpack Corporation, has partnered with HP to digitize and transform the production of molded fiber packaging, significantly reducing CO2 emissions and replacing plastic with sustainable solutions. The collaboration allows for the manufacturing of high-quality, eco-friendly products using HP's advanced tooling technology, which enhances efficiency and sustainability. Both companies aim to lead innovation in the molded fiber industry and are committed to reducing environmental impacts. The initiative exemplifies a shared vision for a sustainable future in packaging.
